title: OData tool broken with 401 error - Analytics API authorization issue
description: The OData tool (wit-odata-query) is failing with 401 Unauthorized error. Error message: 'TF400813: The user is not authorized to access this resource.' This was working previously (commit d4d9e56). Need to investigate if it's an authentication scope issue, permissions issue, or API endpoint change. User may be missing 'View analytics' permission at project level.

title: Add list-team-members tool for discovering team composition
description: Implemented wit-list-team-members tool that discovers team members by analyzing work item assignments. Uses OData Analytics to find users with assigned work. Supports detailed and email-list output formats for WIQL queries. Includes handler, schema, tool config, and feature specification.

title: Fixed OData natural language query execution and velocityMetrics field compatibility
description:
Fixed two critical issues in wit-odata-query tool:

1. Natural language queries (description parameter) now execute automatically and return results - previously only generated the query string
2. velocityMetrics queryType no longer requires StoryPoints field - now uses CompletedDate, ClosedDate, WorkItemType, Title for maximum compatibility

Changes:
- Modified odata-query.handler.ts to execute AI-generated queries automatically
- Updated velocityMetrics to use generic completion fields instead of hardcoded StoryPoints
- Updated documentation in QUERY_TOOLS.md and ODATA_QUERY_OPTIMIZATION.md

Impact: Fixes broken natural language velocity queries and ensures velocityMetrics works across all Azure DevOps projects.

title: Remove list-team-members tool - not providing value
description: Removed wit-list-team-members tool that was not working well and not providing value. Deleted handler, schema, tool config, feature spec, and all references.

title: Remove list-team-members tool - not providing value
description: Removed wit-list-team-members tool that was not working well and not providing value. Deleted handler, schema, tool config, feature spec, and all references.

title: Rename all 25 MCP tools to verb-first convention
description: Systematic renaming of all tool names from wit-* prefix to verb-first naming (e.g., wit-wiql-query -> query-wiql). Requires updates to: tool configs, handlers, tool-service.ts, README.md, docs, resources, and prompts.

title: Remove standalone wit-validate-hierarchy tool
description: Removed wit-validate-hierarchy as a standalone tool. Hierarchy validation is now only available within wit-analyze-by-query-handle using analysisType=['hierarchy']. Created hierarchy-validator-fast.ts service for rule-based validation. Cleaned up imports, schemas, tool configs, constants, and documentation references.

title: query-wiql: Show generated query when using natural language
description: Implemented generated_query field in all response paths when description parameter is used for AI generation

title: Add functionality to discover current iteration path and include it in config for new work items
description: When not otherwise specified, new items should use the current iteration path. Keep in mind that this can change so it should not be hardcoded as one thing. This requires querying ADO to get the current iteration for the team/area.

title: Add functionality to discover current iteration path and include it in config for new work items
description: When not otherwise specified, new items should use the current iteration path. Keep in mind that this can change so it should not be hardcoded as one thing. This requires querying ADO to get the current iteration for the team/area.

title: Define AI analysis tool for intelligent query handle analysis
description: Create a new AI analysis tool that accepts a query handle and natural language intent, retrieves full context packages, performs intelligent AI analysis, and returns concise results. This consolidates analyze-workitem, analyze-assignment, analyze-workload, recommend-parent, and plan-sprint into a unified analyze-bulk tool with analysis type parameters.

title: Document Analytics API permission requirements
description: Create clear documentation explaining that OData Analytics queries require 'View analytics' permission at the project level in Azure DevOps. Document the difference between Analytics API permissions and regular work item read permissions. Add troubleshooting guide for 401 errors. Suggest WIQL as fallback option.

title: Refactor analysis tools into analyze-bulk parameters
description: Convert analyze-workitem, analyze-assignment, and recommend-parent into operation types within the analyze-bulk tool. This reduces tool confusion and consolidates analysis operations.

title: Fix iteration path discovery for non-standard area path structures
description: Current iteration path discovery assumes standard area path format (Project\Team\SubArea) where segments[1] is the team name. However, actual area path structures may differ. User reports: Area path leads to discovering 'One\Custom\Azure\CY2022H1 - Nickel\12 - December' but actual team is 'Krypton' with iteration 'One\Krypton'. Need to make team name extraction more flexible or configurable.

title: Address beta tester feedback - 3 improvement requests
description: Implement 3 improvements from beta tester feedback: 1) Add human-readable time fields to query handle responses, 2) Include score legends in AI analysis output, 3) Clarify when wit-extract-security-links should be used

title: Fix personal workload analyzer to use CONTAINS for email matching
description: The personal-workload analyzer uses exact equality for System.AssignedTo field, but ADO stores 'Display Name <email@domain.com>' format. Need to use CONTAINS operator instead.

title: Fixed: ai-query-analyzer prompt not found error
description: Moved ai-query-analyzer.md from prompts/ to prompts/system/ to match loadSystemPrompt expectations. The SamplingClient was failing to load the system prompt because it was looking in the system subdirectory.

title: Enhanced: Better error messages for sprint planner 404s
description: Added validation and enhanced error messages in sprint-planner.ts to help users debug 404 errors. Now includes organization and project names in error messages and validates these are present before making API calls.

title: Fixed: Sprint planner 404 error with project-scoped WIQL
description: Changed sprint planner to use organization-level WIQL queries instead of project-scoped queries. This matches the WIQL tool behavior and avoids 404 errors when project-scoped endpoints have permission issues. Project scope is still enforced via area path filtering in WHERE clauses.

title: Add batch personal workload analysis tool
description: Create analyze-workload-batch tool that processes multiple team members in parallel and returns all results at once. This improves performance for team health analysis.

title: Add tool to discover available subagents in repositories
description: Create a new MCP tool that scans /.azuredevops/policies directory in Azure DevOps repos to find specialized Copilot agents. Tool should parse YAML metadata (name and description) and return a list of available subagents.

title: OData handler fixed - added parameter validation
description: Fixed OData Analytics handler to validate organization and project parameters before constructing API URLs. Previously, if these parameters were undefined, the URL would contain 'undefined' values causing 401 authorization errors. Added defensive validation with clear error messages guiding users to check their MCP server CLI configuration.

title: OData 401 root cause: OAuth vs Azure CLI authentication mismatch
description: The MCP server was using 'interactive' OAuth authentication by default, but the Analytics API requires Azure CLI tokens. When users tested manually with 'az account get-access-token', it worked, but the MCP server's OAuth tokens were rejected with 401. Solution: Added --authentication azcli flag to mcp.json configuration to force Azure CLI token usage.

title: Subagent discovery not parsing YAML metadata correctly
description: wit-list-subagents scans files but doesn't extract metadata. Need to debug YAML parsing and content fetching logic.

title: OData queries now use Azure CLI auth by default
description: Changed OData handler to automatically use Azure CLI authentication for Analytics API calls. OAuth tokens don't work with Analytics API, so this ensures OData queries work out of the box without requiring --authentication azcli flag.

title: API returns metadata object instead of file content
description: Git Items API with includeContent=true returns {objectId, gitObjectType, commitId, path} instead of actual file content. Need to use different endpoint or download method.

title: Optimize hierarchy validation output to return handles by default
description: Modified wit-validate-hierarchy tool to return only summary counts and query handles by default, avoiding token bloat from duplicate violation arrays. Added includeViolationDetails flag (default false) to optionally include full data. Updated tool descriptions and documentation. Reduces response size by ~3x for typical validation results.
